title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 211.51 - Loss of mouthpiece
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 211.51 - Loss of mouthpiece

State Regulations

In the event that a boxer loses his or her mouthpiece, the
referee shall call time during a lull in the action of the contest and cause
such boxer's seconds to install a backup mouthpiece or promptly wash and
reinstall the same mouthpiece. If a referee determines that a boxer has
deliberately spit out his or her mouthpiece for any reason, the referee may
issue a warning to such boxer or deduct one or more points from such boxer and, upon any subsequent such infraction, may disqualify the boxer by declaring the
opponent a winner. Notes

Adopted

New

York State Register September 21, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 38, eff. 9/21/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
